TopicTitle: Intrepid Kerbal explorers have set up a new launch site on planet Gamefly.

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="http://media.tumblr.com/77add3beac648b1aa2ab36a0e0f19f92/tumblr_inline_mvuukdLqtt1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p></p>

<p>Intrepid Kerbal explorers have set up a new launch site on planet <strong><a href="http://goo.gl/g8e7cM">Gamefly</a></strong>.</p>

I don't know what it is, but whatever that's good news!

(I think?)
I think this means there is another place where you can purchase KSP?

I don't know what it is, but whatever that's good news!

(I think?)

I'm glad I'm not the only one who didn't know. Wiki says it's like a Netflix for games, but looking at the site it seems like another sales page for the Steam distribution of KSP.

screenshots seem to go from very new to very old as you scroll thru them...

....interesting...

If you're in the UK and want to save pennies, you might want to check the exchange rate and your bank's exchange policy before buying through Gamefly. They're charging Ã‚Â£17.99 for KSP right now, which works out to quite a bit more than $23 USD (or Ã‚Â£14.40 at current market rates).
Still not available in the Mac store portion of their site.

If you're in the UK and want to save pennies, you might want to check the exchange rate and your bank's exchange policy before buying through Gamefly. They're charging Ã‚Â£17.99 for KSP right now, which works out to quite a bit more than $23 USD (or Ã‚Â£14.40 at current market rates).

More Money for squad from those who accidentally buy it there!

..Or Not. The US Dollar is plummeting in value at times these days.
